commit_message: Add ability to specify window B in traveling ratio
Fix issues with null in sample table
Add ability to change resolution in bwtools query
Add ability to specify and combine fastqs in the sample table
Move simulation samples to own branch
Update coverage and norm to use new tmm
Update tmm to properly take into account lib size
Add edgeRs TMM approach as a spike-in norm
Bring stranded and non-stranded version of bwtools into parity
Enable upstream and downstream of expected regions
Add more ways to read normalize for regression scaling
fix multicompare examples with appropriate syntax
Spike in scaling with no regions
Add ability to scale by scalefactors

Add motif calling and update peak calling

WIP. Left to do:
* Update variant calling logic
* Check on peak calling logic

Merge pull request #29 from mikewolfe/develop

Add region-based summary calculations for RNAP ChIP

Added
* Added relative polymerase progression calculation to bwtools_query (http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.molcel.2014.02.005)
* Add the ability to smooth raw signals using convolution with a Gaussian or flat kernel.
* Add the ability to smooth raw signals using a Savitzky-Golay filter
* Ability to calculate the region-level spearman correlations for a set of samples in bwtools_query
* Add calculations of the traveling ratio (10.1016/j.molcel.2008.12.021)
* Add discovery of a local max within a region
Changed
* Output of bwtools_query is now compressed (gzip). File extension changed to .tsv.gz
Merge mix and match scaling from master
Flip numerator and denominator for traveling ratio
Add traveling ratio and peak summits

Merge pull request #28 from mikewolfe/mix_scaling

Allow mixing of scaling methods
Allow Gaussian width to be specified. Deal with contig < window

Add a summary table to variant calling

Add variant calling with `breseq` and NaN filters in summaries

Add spike-in normalization. Update genbank parsing.

Release 0.1.0
Update bwtools query to support summary stats
Add reciprocal ratio option for ratio calculations

Custom log2ratio calling with bwtools. Enable drop of NaN and Infs

Update numpy in peak_calling environment

Update bwtools to enable postprocessing summaries

Add postprocessing module

Add support for known background-based normalization
Add support for known background-based normalization

Merge pull request #12 from mikewolfe/feature-11

Add ability to mask regions of the genome from analysis

Add needed test files and update documentation

- Added an ecoli_rrnD.fa file for testing multi contigs
- Added an ecoli_rrns.bed file for testing masked regions
- Added bed_utils.py for parsing beds

Allow for specification of pseudocount in log2 ratio

- Previously was silently defaulting to 1
- Also tweaked parameters to default to
    - dropping zero/zero locations
    - dropping nan regions

Add ability to mask regions of the genome

- fasta.py gets a new mutate method
- combine_fasta.py is updated to accept a masked_regions argument
- alignment module accepts masked region .bed to replace sequence with Ns before alignment
- coverage_and_norm module adds masked region to all deeptools calls through a blacklist
- bwtools is updated to not write regions of bigwig that are nans
Update links to issues on changelog

Add support for multiple contigs through coverage and norm

WIP. Peak calling is broken for now

Add multiple contig support through alignment module

Additional work is needed to add support for downstream modules.
WIP.

Merge pull request #4 from mikewolfe/issue-3

Change output file ending in rule run_coverage_and_norm
Change output file ending in rule run_coverage_and_norm

Remove unsupported config option for summary plots

To be added back at later date when fully implemented.

Force execution of multiqc when running pipeline

Also updated the README with details on running on managed clusters

Clean up SnakeFile and add run_all rule

Removed old code to do summary plots. May be revisited later

Minor bug fixes

- Add a .gitignore file
- Fix issues with log output in coverage_and_norm.smk

Add peak calling with CMARRT and Macs2

- Did some tweaks to give good error messages and
warnings for missing config options.
- Moved some functions out of rule files to the main
SnakeFile to make them global rules

Make quality_control completely modular.

This includes:
- Own environment
- Own directory under results
- A run rule
- A clean rule

Will make other modules do the same.

Add overall rules for coverage and normalization

Also did minor reorganization to reduce code reuse

Initial commit

This is a work in progress rewrite of an old pipeline that had
horrible input conventions. Here I have started doing the
following:

- Organizing and modularizing the pipeline to snakemake
  conventions
- Using PEP to control sample input and metadata
  (http://pep.databio.org/en/2.0.0/)
- Generalizing the pipeline to handle more input

Currently the pipeline is a mix of new and old and has only
been dry-run tested through alignment.
